intro: Lacistema krukovii, commonly known as the Krukovii's milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its milky sap contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
